Property Law.question: The following except one are circumstances warranting the need for a power of attorney:

options.a: Where the expertise of the donee is required
options.c: Where a mortgage is created by subdemise under the Conveyancing Act
options.d: Where a mortgage is created by subdemise under the PCL .

Property Law.answer: Where a mortgage is created by subdemise under the PCL .
Property Law.reason: Where a mortgage is created by Sub-demise under PCL states, there is no need to insert any remedial devices like power of attorney or trust Declaration to protect the mortgagee in the event of default by the mortgagor.

Property Law.question: Exchange of contract gives to the Purchaser one of the following titles:
Property Law.reason: One of the legal effects of Exchange of contract at the contract stage is that the purchaser acquires equitable title in the property. Legal title is still with the vendor. The legal title will only pass when a deed of assignment is executed at the Completion stage.

Property Law.question: The key feature that distinguishes a deed of lease from other deeds is the presence of:
Property Law.reason: Reddendum is the rent clause which is only found in a deed of lease.

Property Law.question: One of the following is not an essential element of a valid lease:
Property Law.reason: Rent is not an essential requirement for the validity of a lease. A lease agreement can be valid notwithstanding the fact that the lessee pays no rent.

Property Law.question: Which of these is not a way of creating an equitable mortgage?

options.a: Agreement to create a legal mortgage
options.b: Creation of an imperfect legal mortgage
options.c: Creation of mortgage with equitable interest

Property Law.reason: Creation of mortgage by sub-demise is a way of creating legal mortgage applicable in all the jurisdictions.

Property Law.question: Where a mortgagee has two or more mortgages on different properties with the same Mortgagor, the mortgagee may refuse to permit the mortgagor to redeem one without the other(s) through the doctrine of:
Property Law.reason: Consolidation is the right the mortgagee of two or more mortgages on different property with the same mortgagor has to refuse to permit the mortgagor to redeem one without redeeming the others. This clause must be expressely stated and agreed to.

Property Law.question: In a legal mortgage created by deed, the power to appoint a receiver:

options.b: Must be expressly provided in the deed
options.c: Is subject to approval by the court
options.d: Must be subject to the consent of the Governor.

Property Law.reason: In a legal mortgage, the power to appoint a receiver is implied; it need not be expressly provided in the Deed of legal mortgage. However, in an equitable mortgage, the power of appointment must be expressly stated in the Deed.

Property Law.question: Legal services such as searches at the Land Registry and the Corporate Affairs Commission can be charged under what scale of the Bill of Charges?
Property Law.reason: There are limited circumstances where a lawyer may charge under scale I (sales, purchases and mortgages) and scale II (Leases). The circumstances where a lawyer may charge using scale III are not limited, but the transaction must not be a contentious one. Thus searches at the land registry and CAC may be charged under scale III.

Property Law.question: A will is ambulatory because:

options.a: It speaks from the death of the testator
options.b: It is revocable at any time before the death of the testator
options.d: It distributes the testator’s estate upon his death.

Property Law.answer: It is revocable at any time before the death of the testator
Property Law.reason: To say something is ambulatory means that it only becomes binding after the testator is no longer alive thus a testator can always change or even revoke the will before his death.

Property Law.question: The authority for the principle that a blind man can make a Will is:
Property Law.reason: John Intsiful v. Henry Charles Christian Kofi Ampah WACA 81994

Property Law.question: Which of the following documents is not needed in processing an application for probate by the executors?

options.d: Letter of authority of the family members

Property Law.answer: Letter of authority of the family members
Property Law.reason: The Will is the letter of authority for the executors to act. There is no requirement of a separate letter of authority by the family of a deceased before the executors can apply for probate.

Property Law.question: All but one of the following are features of an Assent:

options.b: It is used to transfer title in movable properties of the deceased

Property Law.reason: An Assent does not need to be by Deed.

Property Law.question: The circumstances in which the executors of a deceased estate would be entitled to remuneration do not include:

options.a: By the consent of the beneficiaries
options.b: By an order of the Court
options.c: The rule in Cradock v Piper

Property Law.answer: By the consent of the beneficiaries
Property Law.reason: The Beneficiaries consenting to remunerate the executor is not binding. There has to be an express provision, or an order of court or follow the rule in Cradock v Piper 1850

Property Law.question: NOW THIS DEED WITNESSES AS FOLLOWS is the usual beginning of what part of a deed?
Property Law.reason: Testatum is not a part of a deed. There are four parts of a deed:introductory, operative,miscellaneous and concluding parts. Testatum is Under the operative part.

Property Law.question: The Power of Attorney granted to a person to “let premises to tenants and collect rent” is?
Property Law.reason: A power donated is to complete specific things thus, its a specific POA

Property Law.question: The stages of contract of sale of land in Nigeria do not include:
Property Law.reason: They are five stages of a contract of sale. Pre-Contract, Contract, Post-Contract, Completion and Post-Completion stage

Property Law.question: The factors to be considered when fixing rent do not include:

options.d: State and condition of the property

Property Law.reason: The economic status of the tenant is usually immaterial when considering the amount to charge as rent on a property.

Property Law.question: The apex mortgage institution in Nigeria is?
Property Law.reason: The Federal Mortgage Bank of Nigeria is the apex mortgage institution in Nigeria because it regulates and supervises the mortgage industry.

Property Law.question: A solicitor acting for both the lessor and lessee in a lease transaction shall be entitled to his professional fee as follows:

options.a: Full payment from the lessee and half payment from the lessor
options.b: Full payment from the lessor and half of the lessees fee
options.c: Full payment from the lessor and quarter of lessors fee from the lessee

Property Law.reason: In leases, the lessors solicitor is entitled to the full charges as computed according to the scale, while the lessees solicitor is entitled to half of what the lessors solicitor is entitled to. Where a solicitor acts for both parties, he will be entitled to full charges from the lessor plus half of what is due to the lessees solicitor or quarter of lessors fee.

Property Law.question: The legal age approved under the Wills Act for a person to make a Will is?
Property Law.reason: Sec.24 Wills Act

Property Law.question: The Property and Conveyancing Law is applicable in all but one of the following states:
Property Law.reason: The Property and Conveyancing Law (PCL) is applicable in the States belonging to the old Western Region: Ondo, Oyo, Osun, Ogun, Edo, Ekiti and Delta (OOOOEED). Lagos is not part of those States. Lagos has its own separate laws like the Mortgage and Property Law, Lagos State Land Registration Law.

Property Law.question: Tunde Adisa has agreed to sell his plot of Land situate at No. 8, Akonduma street, Asaba to Mike Ontario for the sum of ₦1,000,000. Which of the following laws will be inapplicable in the above transaction?
Property Law.reason: The property in the question is situate in Asaba, Delta State, where the PCL and not the Conveyancing Act (CA) is applicable. Note that the CA is applicable to States in the old Eastern and Northern region.

Property Law.question: The transaction involving land which is usually but not necessarily for consideration is?
Property Law.reason: Lease is the transfer of possession in a property for a term of years certain, usually but not necessarily for consideration. Rent is not an essential requirement for the validity of a lease agreement. But Sale, Assignment and Mortgage always involve consideration.

Property Law.question: One of the following is not true of the uses of a deed:

options.a: To effect conveyance of an interest, right or property in a real estate
options.b: Create an obligation binding on a person
options.c: Confirm some act whereby an interest or property has already passed

Property Law.reason: A deed can be used to convey an interest in land, create an obligation binding on a party or confirm an act whereby an interest has already passed.

Property Law.question: All are essential elements for the validity of a deed except:
Property Law.reason: Attestation is not a mandatory requirement of a deed, but it is useful as when coupled with signing, it raises the presumption of due execution. (see section 159 EA). However, in some instances, attestation is mandatory. The basic features of a deed are: signing, sealing and delivery.

Property Law.question: A Deed will require mandatory attestation where one of the following is a party:

options.b: Business Name registered under Part E

Property Law.reason: A deed will require mandatory attestation in the following circumstances: a- Where an illiterate or Blind person is a party, b- Corporate bodies. Note that there's a presumption in favour of due execution of a power of attorney where it is attested to before a notary public, magistrate or commissioner for Oaths (see s. 150 EA)

Property Law.question: One of the following is not one of the effects of a receipt clause in a deed:

options.a: Makes the issuance of a separate receipt unnecessary
options.b: It constitutes good root of title to the transaction contained in the Deed.
options.c: It is evidence of payment of consideration.
options.d: It is authority to pay the sum to the Vendor’s solicitor where he presents such instrument

Property Law.answer: It constitutes good root of title to the transaction contained in the Deed.
Property Law.reason: A receipt clause does not constitute evidence of a good root of title to land transaction.

Property Law.question: One of the following is not true of a deed delivered in escrow:

options.a: The deed is binding from the date of execution
options.b: The innocent party is entitled to withdraw if the conditions are not fulfilled
options.c: The deed is not binding until condition is fulfilled

Property Law.answer: The deed is not binding until condition is fulfilled
Property Law.reason: A deed in escrow takes effect (binding) upon delivery subject to the fulfillment of the conditions. One party cannot unilaterally withdraw from the agreement within this period. When the conditions are met, the doctrine of relating back transfers the effective date of delivery to the date the deed was delivered, not the date the conditions were performed.

Property Law.question: The order of perfection of a deed of  Assignment on a property located in Asaba, Delta is?
Property Law.reason: The order of perfection of a deed is Consent, Stamping and Registration (CSR). Irrespective of the location of the property

Property Law.question: For a property situate at No. 13, Onipanu, Bwari, Abuja the stamp duty payable on the Deed of assignment for its sale shall be assessed as?
Property Law.reason: The stamp duty payable on a deed of assignment is ad valorem, meaning it is calculated based on the value of the property. However, for a contract of sale of land, the stamp duty payable is fixed.

Property Law.question: A Purchaser of part of the property of a vendor is not entitled to the entire title documents but can be protected by:
Property Law.reason: Acknowledgement for custody and production is a clause contained in the miscellaneous part of a deed. It is to protect an assignee who has purchased a part of a property covered by a single document, which cannot be given to him.

Property Law.question: One of the following is not a reason why a Deed of assignment should not be dated:

options.a: Because of the uncertainty of when Governor consent would be obtained
options.b: To avoid the incidence of late stamping
options.c: To avoid the incidence of late registration
options.d: To give the assignee ample time to investigate the assignor title

Property Law.answer: To give the assignee ample time to investigate the assignor title
Property Law.reason: It is advised that a Deed should not be dated because of the uncertainty of  time in getting the governor’s consent and to avoid the incident of penalties for late stamping and late registration. Once dated, the deed must be stamped within 30 days and registered within 60 days

Property Law.question: When a vendor conveys property as beneficial owner, one of the following is not implied:

options.a: That the lease is valid and subsisting
options.d: Freedom from encumbrances except those disclosed.

Property Law.answer: That the lease is valid and subsisting
Property Law.reason: This will only be implied when the property is covered by a Certificate of Occupancy. if it is not expressly stated that it is, then assume the property is a freehold

Property Law.question: A purchaser who wishes to pay the balance of the purchase money to the vendor solicitor may protect himself by inserting in the Deed of Assignment____

options.c: Safe custody and acknowledgement for production clause

Property Law.reason: One of the functions of a receipt clause is that it serves as authority to the buyer to pay the consideration to the vendor solicitor. Sec. 56, CA and Sec. 94, PCL.

Property Law.question: Pick out the odd one from the following.
Property Law.reason: All the cases apart from Awojugbabe Light Industries v Chinukwe, are specifically under Power of Attorney.

Property Law.question: Only one of the following is not a feature of a power of attorney:

options.a: It is an instrument of delegation
options.b: It is a valid means of transfer of interest in land
options.c: It is a specie of a deed poll

Property Law.answer: It is a valid means of transfer of interest in land
Property Law.reason: Power of attorney is an instrument of delegation, not one of transfer of interest in land.

Property Law.question: The following are not incorrect about Power of attorney except:

options.a: It does not transfer interest in land
options.b: It is an instrument of delegation
options.c: It has no special mode of creation in all instances
options.d: It should expressly state the power which the Donee can exercise.

Property Law.answer: It has no special mode of creation in all instances
Property Law.reason: There is a special mode of creation in certain instances. For example, it must be created by deed where the Donee will execute a deed.

Property Law.question: If in a formal contract executed by parties, there is possession before completion clause, the vendor is advised to let the purchaser in as a/an:
Property Law.reason: Where there is possession before completion in a contract of sale; it is advisable for the vendor to let the purchaser in as a licensee so that in the event of default, one does not have to go through the rigorous process of regaining the property. As a licensee, All that is required is a 7 days’ notice of eviction. Street v Mountford.

Property Law.question: The stamp duty payable on a contract of sale of land is
Property Law.reason: Contract of sale of land attracts a fixed stamp duty unlike a deed of assignment, where the stamp duty payable is advalorem.

Property Law.question: A contract of sale of land is a registrable instrument in all but one of the following states
Property Law.reason: Contract of sale is a registrable instrument in the PCL states of the old Western region, but it is not in the Northern States. Sec. 58, Laws of Northern Nigeria. In the Eastern States, the law is silent, but in the case of Okoye v Dumez it was held that a contract of sale is registrable.
